title: Improving Estimation Efficiency via Regression-Adjustment in Covariate-Adaptive Randomizations with Imperfect Compliance. (arXiv:2201.13004v5 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: We investigate how to improve efficiency using regression adjustments with covariates in covariate-adaptive randomizations (CARs) with imperfect subject compliance. Our regression-adjusted estimators, which are based on the doubly robust moment for local average treatment effects, are consistent and asymptotically normal even with heterogeneous probability of assignment and misspecified regression adjustments. We propose an optimal but potentially misspecified linear adjustment and its further improvement via a nonlinear adjustment, both of which lead to more efficient estimators than the one without adjustments. We also provide conditions for nonparametric and regularized adjustments to achieve the semiparametric efficiency bound under CARs.

translated_title: 利用回归调整提高协变量自适应随机化中的估计效率（带有不完美遵从性）
translated_abstract: 我们研究如何在存在不完美受试者遵从性的协变量自适应随机化（CAR）中，使用回归调整与协变量来提高效率。我们的回归调整估计量基于局部平均治疗效应的双重稳健矩，即使在存在异质的分配概率和错误的回归调整情况下，也是一致且渐近正常的。我们提出了一种最优的线性调整方法，但可能存在回归模型错误，通过非线性调整进一步提高效率，这两种调整方法都比没有调整的方法产生更高效的估计值。我们还提供了非参数和正则化调整的条件，以在CARs下达到半参数效率界限。
tldr: 该论文研究了在协变量自适应随机化中如何使用回归调整提高效率，并提出了最优线性调整和非线性调整方法，这些方法比没有调整的方法产生更高效的估计值。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates how to improve efficiency using regression adjustments with covariates in covariate-adaptive randomizations (CARs) with imperfect subject compliance. The proposed optimal linear and nonlinear adjustments lead to more efficient estimators than the one without adjustments. The paper also provides conditions for nonparametric and regularized adjustments to achieve the semiparametric efficiency bound under CARs.
